abstract: SoundExchange, the agency that compensates performers and record labels when music is played on satellite and Internet radio, reported $292 million in royalties. Also, the Pirate Bay add a promotional site.
snippet: SoundExchange, the agency that compensates performers and record labels when music is played on satellite and Internet radio, reported $292 million in royalties. Also, the Pirate Bay add a promotional site.
lead_paragraph: Royalties Increase for Streaming: SoundExchange, the agency that compensates performers and record labels when music is played on satellite and Internet radio, paid $292 million in royalties last year, up 17 percent from 2010, the group announced. SoundExchange signed up 15,300 new artists and labels last year, yet the agency is still often criticized in the music industry for holding back royalties from unregistered acts and has faced challenges from its biggest contributor, Sirius XM Radio.

headline.main: Digital Notes: Royalties for Streaming Music Grew 17% in 2011
